content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can write a function to clean column names as follows:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Lowercase the string
    lc = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    stripped = strip(lc)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    cleaned = replace(stripped, " " => "_") |> replace("-" => "_")
    
    return cleaned
end
```

This function `clean_column` takes a string (`col`) as input and returns the cleaned column name in lowercase with no leading or trailing whitespaces and with spaces and hyphens replaced by underscores.
